page.title: 04TARRANT MONKTON + LAUNCESTON
page.content: Tarrant monkton is a village of 2,000 acres or so situated entirely on chalk across the Tarrant valley.It is between 160 to 400 feet above sea level.At the centre of the village is the church of All Saints and the village pub the Langton Arms which has an excellent restaurant as well as a skittle alley and beer garden.There are lots of thatched cottages in the village and the road goes through the Tarrant at the ford.There used to be a shop but it is now closed. Tarrant Launceston is also on chalk and is on both sides of the Tarrant Valley.It used to be joined to Monkton but is now separate.There are not many houses now but there is a large farm called Launceston Farm which is the main building.
